required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug-eluting PTA Balloon Dilatation Catheter in the Treatment of Peripheral Artery Stenosis or Occlusion
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of ZENFlow™ Drug-eluting PTA Balloon Dilatation Catheter in the Treatment of Iliac, Femoral and Popliteal Artery Stenosis or Occlusion

lead_sponsor.agency: Zhejiang Zylox Medical Device Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Zhejiang Zylox Medical Device Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical study on safety and efficacy of ZENFlow™ drug-eluting PTA balloon dilatation catheter in the treatment of iliac, femoral and popliteal artery stenosis or occlusion

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ZENFlow™ drug-eluting PTA balloon dilatation catheter (paclitaxel 3±1 μg/mm2 balloon surface area) in the treatment of iliac artery, femoral artery and popliteal stenosis or occlusive lesions compared with conventional PTA balloon dilatation catheter.

primary_outcome.measure: Late Lumen Loss at 6 months after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of major adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Related to death of clinical trials

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative、Intraoperative、up to 1 month、3 months、6 months、9 months、12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse medical events, whether or not related to the medical device

arm_group.description: subjects using the drug-eluting PTA balloon dilatation catheter
subjects using the peripheral balloon dilatation catheter

intervention.intervention_name: ZENFlow™ Drug-eluting PTA Balloon Dilatation Catheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged from 18 to 85 years old, male or female
- Subject's target lesions were stenosis and/or occlusion
- Subjects were able to understand the purpose of the study, demonstrate full compliance with the program and sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman or who's pregnancy test is positive
- Lactation period woman or woman/man with fertility plan
